title.native: 東京ミュウミュウ にゅ～♡

description:
The scientists of the μ(Mew) Project use DNA of endangered species to create a team of heroines imbued with amazing super-human abilities. One of them, Ichigo Momomiya, awakens to discover she is armed with all the skills of a Iriomote cat. Ichigo must band together with other Mew Mew girls to repel an alien incursion, all the while hiding their thrilling double lives from friends and family.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

tags.name: Shoujo
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult females.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Maids
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a maid.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Environmental
tags.description: Concern with the state of the natural world and how humans interact with it.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

node.description:
She often wore cat ears to her book signings, and interesting costumes. Mia's first manga story *The Sleeping Beauty of Strawberry Forest* was written when she was just 18 years old.

Mia Ikumi passed away on March 7, 2022 due to a subarachnoid hemorrhage surrounding the brain.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/吉田玲子) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reiko_Yoshida)

Yoshida has written and supervised numerous scripts for anime series, live-action dramas and films. Her major works include [Kaleido Star](https://anilist.co/anime/427), [Aria](https://anilist.co/anime/477), [Maria-sama ga Miteru](https://anilist.co/anime/158), [D.Gray-man](https://anilist.co/anime/1482), [K-On!](https://anilist.co/anime/5680), [Bakuman](https://anilist.co/anime/7674) and [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131). In more recent works, she has supervised the screenplays for [Majestic Prince](https://anilist.co/anime/15863), [Non Non Biyori](https://anilist.co/anime/17549), [A Town Where You Live](https://anilist.co/anime/17741), [Tamako Market](https://anilist.co/anime/16417), [Yowamushi Pedal](https://anilist.co/anime/18179) and [Castle Town Dandelion](https://anilist.co/anime/20951). In films, she wrote the screenplay for Ghibli's [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597), the original films that would make up [Digimon: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/2961), Kyoto Animation’s hit anime film [A Silent Voice](https://anilist.co/anime/20954), and the film adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's [Buddha](https://anilist.co/anime/7014), the last one's [second film](https://anilist.co/anime/20500) was given a stamp of approval by the Dalai Lama.

Among her works, she was recognized for Best Screenplay/Original Work for [Girls und Panzer](https://anilist.co/anime/14131) at the Tokyo Anime Award Festival in 2014, and she won another Best Screenplay/Original Work award in 2017. In 2018, she wrote the screenplay for [Violet Evergarden](https://anilist.co/anime/21827) which aired on TV in Japan and is licensed by Netflix.

Yoshida also wrote the story for the manga series [Tokyo Mew Mew](https://anilist.co/manga/30554).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

Affiliated with [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company).

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.

Affiliated with [Yumeta Company](https://anilist.co/studio/96/Yumeta-Company).

Worked as a composite artist in the beginning of his career.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

Originally an animator. Often works with [Makoto Moriwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109581/).
Tatsuya Ishiguro is an animation producer and director.
